criteria: Understanding of the Bill of Rights' Purpose
Ability to Apply Knowledge to Real-World Scenarios
descriptions: Demonstrates no understanding of the Bill of Rights or its purpose in limiting government power.
Shows a very limited understanding of the Bill of Rights, with significant misconceptions about its purpose.
Identifies the Bill of Rights but struggles to explain how it limits the power of the federal and state governments.
Explains that the Bill of Rights limits government power but provides only a superficial explanation or incomplete examples.
Clearly explains how the Bill of Rights limits the power of both the federal and state governments, providing relevant examples.

Provides a comprehensive explanation of how the Bill of Rights limits federal and state power, including nuanced examples and demonstrating a deep understanding of its historical context and ongoing relevance.
Is unable to name any of the rights guaranteed by the Bill of Rights.
Names only one or two rights from the Bill of Rights, with inaccuracies.
Names a few rights from the Bill of Rights but struggles to accurately describe them.
Identifies several rights guaranteed by the Bill of Rights and provides basic descriptions.
Accurately identifies and describes several key rights guaranteed by the Bill of Rights, demonstrating a solid understanding.
Demonstrates comprehensive knowledge of the rights guaranteed by the Bill of Rights, accurately describing a wide range of rights and their implications.
Cannot apply knowledge of the Bill of Rights to any real-world scenarios.
Attempts to apply knowledge of the Bill of Rights but does so inaccurately or irrelevantly.
Struggles to connect the Bill of Rights to real-world scenarios, with limited success.
Applies knowledge of the Bill of Rights to simple real-world scenarios with some accuracy.
Applies knowledge of the Bill of Rights to a variety of real-world scenarios, demonstrating a strong understanding of its practical application.
Critically analyzes complex real-world scenarios in light of the Bill of Rights, demonstrating a sophisticated understanding of its implications and potential conflicts.
